SEARCH
Module org.example.syllllogysme
Package traitement

Class Syllogisme

java.lang.Object
traitement.Syllogisme
All Implemented Interfaces:
Validateur
public class Syllogisme extends Object implements Validateur
The Syllogisme class represents a logical syllogism with major and minor propositions, a conclusion, a figure number, and a list of invalid rules. It provides methods to access the propositions, set validation rules, and determine the validity of the syllogism by applying logical rules. It also includes mechanisms to manage interesting and uninteresting conclusions.

  • Constructor Details

    • Syllogisme

      public Syllogisme()
      Default constructor of the Syllogisme class. Initializes the list of invalid rules.

    • Syllogisme

      public Syllogisme(Quantificateur quantifMajeur, String sujetMajeur, String predicatMajeur, boolean estAffirmativeMajeur, Quantificateur quantifMineur, String sujetMineur, String predicatMineur, boolean estAffirmativeMineur, Quantificateur quantifConclusion, String sujetConclusion, String predicatConclusion, boolean estAffirmativeConclusion)
      Constructor to create a syllogism with detailed information for each proposition (major, minor, conclusion).
      Parameters:
      quantifMajeur - Quantifier of the major premise.
      sujetMajeur - Subject of the major premise.
      predicatMajeur - Predicate of the major premise.
      estAffirmativeMajeur - Boolean indicating if the major premise is affirmative.
      quantifMineur - Quantifier of the minor premise.
      sujetMineur - Subject of the minor premise.
      predicatMineur - Predicate of the minor premise.
      estAffirmativeMineur - Boolean indicating if the minor premise is affirmative.
      quantifConclusion - Quantifier of the conclusion.
      sujetConclusion - Subject of the conclusion.
      predicatConclusion - Predicate of the conclusion.
      estAffirmativeConclusion - Boolean indicating if the conclusion is affirmative.

    • Syllogisme

      public Syllogisme(Quantificateur quantifPremise1, Quantificateur quantifPremise2, Quantificateur quantifConclusion, String sujet, String predicat, String termeMoyen, boolean estAffirmativePremise1, boolean estAffirmativePremise2, boolean estAffirmativeConclusion, int numFigure)
      Constructor to create a syllogism based on the figure of the syllogism.
      Parameters:
      quantifPremise1 - Quantifier of the major premise.
      quantifPremise2 - Quantifier of the minor premise.
      quantifConclusion - Quantifier of the conclusion.
      sujet - Subject of the conclusion.
      predicat - Predicate of the conclusion.
      termeMoyen - Middle term between the premises.
      estAffirmativePremise1 - Boolean indicating if the major premise is affirmative.
      estAffirmativePremise2 - Boolean indicating if the minor premise is affirmative.
      estAffirmativeConclusion - Boolean indicating if the conclusion is affirmative.
      numFigure - Figure number of the syllogism (must be between 1 and 4).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the figure number is outside the range [1, 4].

    • DetecterFigure

      public int DetecterFigure()
      Detects the figure of the syllogism based on the terms of the major and minor premises.
      Returns:
      the figure number (1, 2, 3, or 4) based on the relationships between the terms of the premises. - 1: If the first term of the major premise equals the second term of the minor premise. - 2: If the second term of the major premise equals the second term of the minor premise. - 3: If the first term of the major premise equals the first term of the minor premise. - 4: If the second term of the major premise equals the first term of the minor premise. Returns 0 if no match is found.

    • regleMoyenTerme

      public void regleMoyenTerme()
      The middle term rule states that for a syllogism to be valid, at least one of the middle terms must be universal. If the rule is not valid, it is added to the list of invalid rules.
      Specified by:
      regleMoyenTerme in interface Validateur

    • regleLatius

      public void regleLatius()
      The Latius rule states that if a term is universal in the conclusion, it must also be universal in the premise. If the rule is not valid, it is added to the list of invalid rules.
      Specified by:
      regleLatius in interface Validateur

    • rNN

      public void rNN()
      The rNN rule states that if both premises are negative, no conclusion can be drawn. If the rule is not valid, it is added to the list of invalid rules.
      Specified by:
      rNN in interface Validateur

    • rN

      public void rN()
      The rN rule states that if one premise is negative, the conclusion must also be negative. If the rule is not valid, it is added to the list of invalid rules.
      Specified by:
      rN in interface Validateur
